docs.snippet: The 2018 edition of the New York guide leaves the city with five three-star restaurants.

headline.main: Michelin Drops Jean-Georges to Two Stars

docs.snippet: Houses like Van Cleef & Arpels and Cartier use dazzling exhibitions as part of their strategy to lure the next generation of buyers.
In Cali, dancing can start as early as the afternoon, and the energy never lets up.

headline.main: The Rhythm of Colombia’s Salsa Capital

docs.snippet: David Bouley is opening a culinary center in the Flatiron District that embodies all his ideas on cooking, health and hospitality.

headline.print_headline: A Chef’s Philosophy Blossoms Under One Roof
headline.main: In Bouley at Home, a Chef’s Total Philosophy Under One Roof

docs.snippet: An art installation features mice living below a plexiglass floor on which patrons walk. Animal advocates say the exhibition is cruel.

headline.print_headline: Where Mice Are Underfoot, and Some Call It Cruel
headline.main: Manhattan Gallery’s Squeaking Floor Angers Rodent Lovers

docs.snippet: Friday: An earthquake gives New York a bit of a shake, weekend events, and the only supermoon of the year.

headline.main: New York Today: A Little Quake

docs.snippet: A police officer shot and killed a gunman in Plano, Tex., after responding to reports of shots being fired at a residence.

headline.print_headline: Seven Found Shot to Death in a Home in a Dallas Suburb
headline.main: Gunman Kills 8 at Cookout at Suburban Dallas Home

docs.snippet: Prepare yourself for Halloween on Tuesday, and then indulge with a chickpea tagine or salmon with anchovy-garlic butter.
The tamale-like treats are popular during the holidays, and even more so since Hurricane Maria pummeled the island.

headline.print_headline: For Puerto Ricans, a Taste of Normalcy This Season
headline.main: Pasteles, a Puerto Rican Tradition, Have a Special Savor Now

docs.snippet: Thursday: Tips for less congested holidays, an exhibition of more than 150 menorahs, and nostalgic train rides.

headline.main: New York Today: Holiday Cheer, Without the Crowds
